text: gosh hi everyone
here the internet's busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of this new
Depeche Mode record momento Mori
legendary synth pop and New Wave outfit
Depeche Mode they're back 15th
full-length LP it has been quite a while
six years since we heard a record from
these guys which honestly given context
is understandable their last record
Spirit had quite a few Duds on it some
mixed reviews as well arguably their
weakest project to date then you also
have the recent passing of founding
member Andy Fletcher so of course there
were a lot of questions as to how
Depeche Mode would continue without him
even if he wasn't necessarily known for
his formal songwriting credits in the
band now I will say off the bat there is
a pretty noticeable aesthetic change
here on Memento Mori the instrumentals
and the sound of this LP generally
nowhere near is bombastic or as over the
top as Depeche Mode's passed through
records but this new LP here feels like
the band is just kind of stripping
things down going simpler going Starker
bringing in more space and atmosphere
maybe you could even say they're going
back to basics to an extent on this LP
especially given instrumentals on this
thing like people are good which kind of
sounds like some radioactivity error
craft work meanwhile other cuts on here
feel like they're trying to recapture
the rigid Simplicity of the band's 80s
output which is kind of odd because even
when it's been to the dismay of
listeners Depeche Mode has historically
been a band that has continued to look
forward I'm slightly surprised to hear
them put out a record that comes off
this nostalgic and also somehow misses
the mark production wise on some key
moments as there are some cuts on this
thing that feel either like a slight
bore or a slight annoyance to listen to
take the opening track for example which
has a brooding Pace to it Eerie
beckoning vocals from frontman Dave gone
of course two some vaguely industrial
perks and hit some noise here and there
as well look there are some elements of
the track that I like but the churchy
and kind of frightened group vocals that
are transitioned into on the chorus I
think are a severe misstep
they just come off tacked on which I
would also say is the case for the
chorus on Caroline's monkey the chord
changes and winding Melodies on this
point of the song I feel like a very odd
contrast from the rigid grooves and very
Grim storytelling on the verses and
while there are other cuts on the record
like wagging tongue that have a bit more
cohesion at their core I think the
instrumental on this one could have used
a bit more Tempo outside of that it has
all the makings of a Depeche Mode
classic the synths on the bridge of this
track aren't mixed all that well either
as they kind of come in Tower over
everything else and are deafeningly loud
which is a shame because the tune at the
core of this track is solid and Dave
gives a great vocal performance the
sound of the guitars leave a lot to be
desired too on the track ghosts again
like if they were going to sound this
thin and brittle and and just burnt to a
crisp why even have them on the song
it's like a light tinny Buzz that brings
nothing to the track overall and it's
not like the synth patches and perks
outside of that are all that exciting
either for sure they come across old
school but uh still pretty uninspired
the first real Contender on the LP for
me musically is don't say you love me
which is a dramatic string kissed ballad
with a lot of open space to it Dave's
Stellar performance on this track just
eats it all up it's amazing how after
all these years he still sings with so
much presence and conviction there are
some killer lyrics on the cut too
especially toward the end you'll be the
killer I'll be the corpse you'll be the
laughter I'll be the punchline of course
there are more highlights to come deeper
in the record too like soul with me
which is another Spotlight ballad this
one sounds like the saddest Last Dance
ever on prom night which is set in the
midst of a Twin Peaks episode there's
also before we drown the meditative
grooves and dense synth layers on this
track make it one of the most enveloping
on the record the tempos got a bit more
libido to it as well which I love
there's also people are good that I
mentioned earlier I love that to Old
School production on the track and the
song is quality as well
[Music]
gapping on that one and always you is
one of the few moments on this thing of
of nostalgia that I would say could
actually hold a candle to some of the
band's output during like that violator
or music for the masses era but this
time around there's a bit more punch to
the beats the industrial Aesthetics are
turned up a bit it's moody in that
slightly oppressive way but it's still
got a pop of Peel and lo and behold the
Wailing guitars on Never Let Me Go sound
way better than the guitars on the rest
of the record why the album's sound
quality has suddenly like upped a bit on
the tail end of the project I don't know
but it it kind of has once again we have
a performance from Dave that really
sells the track too and the closing Cuts
speak to me is a great send-off for the
record the chilling chord progressions
which are underscored by these
mesmerizing drones you have Dave's
commanding but mournful vocals on top of
that it's a killer combo the build on
the last leg of the song is stellar and
this has to be by at least a few miles
the most emotionally potent Moment On
The Record now look I'll say this the
first half of this LP I think is notably
weaker than the second half and I think
a lot of that comes down to much of the
production uh instrumentation mixing
feels a little too rough around the
edges again it's like they were trying
to capture a vibe from a bygone era in
their catalog and on a few tracks here
and there they just were not that
successful but again they more or less
pulled through toward the Finish Line
with some smash songs as well I'm
feeling a light to decent seven on this
new LP transition have you given this
record listen did you love it did you
hate it what would you rate it you're
the best or the best what should I
